image.altText: anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese expresses his astonishment at claims made by Israel's prime minister that "there is no starvation in Gaza", telling Labor MPs that statement is "beyond comprehension".

title.children: Albanese says Israel's denial of starvation in Gaza 'beyond comprehension'

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in front of a US flag.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump suggests the US's 10 per cent "baseline" tariff, which is placed on most of Australia's exports to the US, could soon increase to 15 or 20 per cent.

title.children: Trump suggests 10pc tariff imposed on Australia could double

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The ASX follows European markets lower as traders evaluate the US-EU trade deal and a new threat by the US president to implement a 15-20 per cent "baseline" tariff. Follow the events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls as trade optimism fades, Trump flags 15-20pc 'baseline' tariff

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Renewables cheapest energy option: new report
Shooting in Manhattan at office which houses Blackstone
Will Australia be subject to a 15 or 20 per cent US tariff?

image.altText: A light-coloured single-storey building with green lawn, a driveway and metal gates in front.

props.synopsis: A Queensland childcare worker has been charged with torturing and repeatedly assaulting a one-year-old baby boy.

title.children: Educator charged with torturing baby boy in childcare centre

image.altText: A glass door with the Ramsay Psychology words and logo on it.

props.synopsis: Face-to-face mental health support saved Kate's life, now her health care provider wants her to move to telehealth instead.

title.children: Clients 'disgusted and appalled' by Ramsay psychology clinic shutdowns

image.altText: ny shooting

props.synopsis: At least five people, including a police officer, are shot dead in a New York office building.

title.children: At least five killed as gunman enters New York office building

image.altText: Sussan Ley during a media conference.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley confirms the Coalition will support the government's childcare reforms while also not standing in the way of a plan to cut student debt. Follow live.

title.children: Coalition to back childcare laws, won't oppose HECs relief

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Israel's denial of starvation in Gaza 'beyond comprehension'
Next question: Does the speaker ever get FOMO?
Speaker Milton Dick joins us for a live Q&A

image.altText: A woman sits on a bench looking at an iPad

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of Australians slugged more than $60 million in excessive bank fees could soon get a refund, but Commonwealth Bank customers may not see a cent of $270 million in unfair charges.

title.children: Commbank refuses to pay millions in refunds to low-income customers

image.altText: Black and white photo of a man holding the steering wheel of a car with his left had. He has a watch on his wrist.

props.synopsis: Some Uber riders are pay up to three times the cost of their trip, with reports of drivers manipulating the system to make more money.

title.children: Uber drivers creating artificial surge prices

image.altText: Children holding empty bowls pushing in a crowd to get food.

props.synopsis: For the first time, the two leading human rights organisations have called for the international community to put pressure on the Netanyahu government to change course in the Palestinian territory.

title.children: Israeli human rights groups say their country is committing genocide in Gaza

image.altText: A man silhouetted against a window.

props.synopsis: The ABC's Foreign Correspondent travels to cartel country in Mexico to see if the government's crackdown on drug cartels is working.

title.children: 'Right now, things is crazy': Why a Sinaloa cartel-linked smuggler is feeling the heat

image.altText: women wearing headscarves carry white cloth with green and red Arabic script. Behind are signs in English and Arabic.

props.synopsis: A viral video of the "honour killing" of a woman and her lover in Pakistan has ignited national outrage, prompting scrutiny of longstanding tribal codes and calls for justice in a country where such killings often pass in silence.

title.children: Viral video of Pakistani 'honour' killing triggers national outrage

image.altText: A close-up of Jim Chalmers in front of a grey background

props.synopsis: There's a great deal riding on the contentious proposal, politically for the Albanese government, personally for Treasurer Jim Chalmers and economically for the nation.

title.children: Gas shortage crisis develops as Santos takeover heats up

image.altText: A smiling woman with blond hair wearing a short blue dress sits outside

props.synopsis: The Vogue spread has sparked significant controversy, with some claiming it threatens diversity in fashion and reinforces already unattainable beauty standards.

title.children: Her features are flawless. But this blonde, blue-eyed Vogue model isn't real

image.altText: A lage building surrounded by snow

props.synopsis: Experts warn Russia and China's plans to expand their presence in Antarctica may be linked to mining or military ambitions in the designated nature reserve.

title.children: Russian and Chinese plans for Antarctic expansion spark alarm

image.altText: A woman speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: The University of Queensland has defended the "fundamental principles of freedom of speech" of researchers who pushed conspiracy theories and misinformation around fire ant treatments and vaccines.

title.children: Academics criticised for stances on fire ant treatment, vaccines

image.altText: a vehicle running over a crocodile at a river crossing

props.synopsis: A video of a large crocodile becoming stuck underneath a ute at a notorious river crossing in the Northern Territory has gone viral online.

title.children: Viral video shows crocodile stuck under vehicle at NT's Cahills Crossing

image.altText: Conceptual illustration of a pair of entangled quantum particles interacting at a distance.

props.synopsis: When a German physicist returned from a health retreat 100 years ago, his ideas sparked a debate about reality, and gave rise to quantum mechanics — the "spooky" science of the very small.

title.children: 100 years ago, a mind-bending idea was born that would prove Einstein wrong

image.altText: Looking up at the pillars outside the Victorian Parliament.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will move to make it even harder for repeat offenders to get bail when parliament resumes today, while the opposition and Greens will scrutinise scandals in the childcare sector.

title.children: Education department to be probed in Greens' parliamentary inquiry into childcare

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell in a white shirt, grinning at the camera

props.synopsis: Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyer says she has not asked for anything from the US government in exchange for her new testimony about convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein but she would "welcome any relief".

title.children: Trump says he has not considered pardoning Epstein ally Maxwell

image.altText: A person holds a phone in from of a laptop, with a green line graph showing a share price going up over time.

props.synopsis: Global financial markets are entering an optimistic but potentially dangerous speculative phase, according to analysts, driven by a mania for so-called meme stocks made popular on social media.

title.children: Analysts say 'greed is good' is back as market euphoria surges

image.altText: An orange ute with bonnet up and doors open, in a showroom.

props.synopsis: Electric vehicles are accelerating in the Australian market, but there are concerns over charging access, affordability and looming tax changes that could stall progress.

title.children: 'Cheaper' electric vehicles flood Australia but face roadblocks

image.altText: A small white building being lowered by a crane.

props.synopsis: The largest modular social housing development in New South Wales is being dubbed a cheaper and quicker solution than traditional building methods.

title.children: Modular homes could be the future for social housing, academic says

image.altText: A portrait of a young woman with black hair sitting in a park.

props.synopsis: Jasmine Flowers was left with life-altering injuries after falling from an e-scooter. She wants riders to understand the risks.

title.children: Teen left with brain injury after e-scooter crash calls for change

image.altText: Houses close to the shore with rocks in front of them on a small peninsula jutting into the ocean.

props.synopsis: Property owners in the SA town of Pelican Point may be sceptical of predictions their town will be under water in 75 years but they are tired of waiting for authorities to act.

title.children: Homeowners take battle with the sea into their own hands

image.altText: Two women, one in indigenous head dress and cloak, smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in Victoria's north-west are the first in the state to be granted exclusive native title rights. But what does that mean and how will it work?

title.children: The strongest form of native title is now in Victoria. Here’s how it works

image.altText: Finn Russell hugs a teammate

props.synopsis: British and Irish Lions fly half Finn Russell stands out on and off the pitch as a master of his craft. He says the calmness he feels as a player is driving him on to help secure a Lions clean sweep over the Wallabies.

title.children: Lions' brilliant midfield general stands above as series finale beckons

image.altText: A Queensland police badge on a sleeve.

props.synopsis: During last October's election campaign, Premier David Crisafulli promised to resign from the top job if there were not fewer victims of crime by the end the term.

title.children: Queensland premier claims drop in victim of crime numbers over six-month period

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he will give Russia 10 to 12 days to agree to a ceasefire with Ukraine, slashing the 50-day deadline he initially floated.

title.children: Trump tells Putin he has '10 to 12' days to end Russia-Ukraine war

image.altText: two police vehicles

props.synopsis: A coroner finds Donald Ward's death following an abandoned police pursuit in Karratha in 2023 was an accident, with attending police and paramedics bearing no responsibility.

title.children: Police, paramedics cleared over Pilbara man's death after abandoned chase

image.altText: Photos of a home with toys, soft furnishings.

props.synopsis: This Sydney mother and her two children fled a violent home with little more than the clothes on their backs. Now they have their very own sanctuary.

title.children: This mum and her kids left a refuge with nothing. Now they have a safe haven

image.altText: Heather Calgaret wears a possum cloak.

props.synopsis: Victorian Aboriginal communities are urging the state government to act on the recommendations of a coroner who investigated the 2021 death in custody of Heather Calgaret.

title.children: Victoria urged to act on coroner's death in custody recommendations

image.altText: Lorena Wiebes wins Tour de France Femmes stage.

props.synopsis: Lorena Wiebes prevails in a chaotic sprint to claim victory in the third stage of the Tour de France Femmes, with fellow Dutch rider Marianne Vos taking the overall lead.

title.children: Wiebes wins chaotic sprint in Tour de France Femmes stage three

image.altText: A stressed female worker looking overwhelmed with things shoved in her face like a phone, diary and watch

props.synopsis: When the pressure is on, it's easy to skip a break to focus on work. But not taking breaks can quickly become a dangerous habit.

title.children: Skipping a work break can cause us long-term harm
